text:
$ARBK Hows everybody holding up? Today I look a little loss grrrrrr. Got choppy in $BABA and got stopped out. Same thing happened with $AMD - think I need to be a bit more patient and focus on  fewer companies etc rather than being 'hoofy'. Watched the screens all day though taking it all in, learning as best I can... 

I did take a little $AAPL short towards end of day which of course I sold far too early gave me a little back... The rush to get in on Apple with the breaking news should have been the main trade for me today. But when it buzzed my phone (which occasionally happens on the investing.com app) I thought maybe the news was a trap but going to check all the charts now to see where I went wrong.
$AAPL NEW ARTICLE : ASX higher as Apple fast tracks its autonomous car development https://www.stck.pro/news/AAPL/18274273

$AAPL It appears people are clueless as to why we’re going to continue to gain. First off, we popped the ATH cherry today leaving us primed to squeeze above due to the absurd amount of options expiring in the money tomorrow. With this squeeze we have news of Apple allowing self-repair of devices which you might think is a nothingburger, right? Wrong, bitch. For those with critical thinking skills, I see this as (a) avoidance of lawsuit and thereby expenses (b) appealing to the demands of shareholders and (c) most fucking importantly of all, it means they have the supply to allow for such repair meaning they’re skirting by the supply chain shortage. Furthermore we get this Apple car shit which honestly, could not care less out of all the reasons. It’ll be slick but let’s focus on the other fact that it’s holiday szn and Apple is gonna be under so many fucking trees this year. 

Alright I’m about to wipe so I can’t type much more. Cheers

- Chad

$AAPL

$AAPL Apple (AAPL) plans to debut its self-driving car in 2025, according to a Bloomberg News report released Thursday citing sources familiar with the matter. 
 
This would not be a vehicle with semi-autonomous features. According to the report, Apple aims to have a hands-off driving design with no steering wheel or pedals. Known as Project Titan, the tech company started on the journey to self-driving cars in 2014 by designing a vehicle from scratch.
